messages.message:
Sometimes, the location of the document the response is referring to doesn't really match with the content of the response.
Here, Converse gives a great response to my question, but the actual information it responded with isn't located on page 8, but rather at page 7.
can you please share the doc?

Somewhat related, in some cases I found the results location box for my document was oversized compared to where the information actually was. E.g. if the information was in a table that took up 25% of the page, the results would highlight 50% of the page. Or if the information was in one column of a two-column article, the results would highlight both columns.
This is expected provenance is still not 100% perfect cc: @Rafal

yeah, even after today’s fixes it won’t be perfect
the goal is rather to point to the approximate location so the user doesn’t have to look at the whole doc
+1 on sharing the doc request - will check if current fixes help :slightly_smiling_face:
Sg! This is the doc just in case it proves useful later for testing.
